title: Follow-Up

days_to_follow_up.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's last follow-up appointment or contact.

adverse_event.description: Text that represents the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events low level term name for an adverse event.
enum: Blood and Lymphatic System Disorders - Other
Congenital, Familial and Genetic Disorders - Other
General Disorders and Administration Site Conditions - Other
Injury, Poisoning and Procedural Complications - Other
Joint Range of Motion Decreased Cervical Spine
Joint Range of Motion Decreased Lumbar Spine
Musculoskeletal and Connective Tissue Disorders - Other
Neoplasms Benign, Malignant and Unspecified (Incl Cysts and Polyps) - Other
Pregnancy, Puerperium and Perinatal Conditions - Other
Reproductive System and Breast Disorders - Other
Respiratory, Thoracic and Mediastinal Disorders - Other
Skin and Subcutaneous Tissue Disorders - Other

adverse_event_grade.description: The text term used to describe a specific histone variants, which are proteins that substitute for the core canonical histones.

aids_risk_factors.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor of  the acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) that the patient either had at time time of the study or experienced in the past.

barretts_esophagus_goblet_cells_present.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether goblet cells were determined to be present in a patient diagnosed with Barrett's esophagus.

bmi.description: A calculated numerical quantity that represents an individual's weight to height ratio.

body_surface_area.description: Numeric value used to represent the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface relating height to weight.

cause_of_response.description: The text term used to describe the suspected cause or reason for the patient disease response.

cd4_count.description: The text term used to describe the outcome of the procedure to determine the amount of the CD4 expressing cells in a sample.

cdc_hiv_risk_factors.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor for human immunodeficiency virus, as described by the Center for Disease Control.

comorbidity.description: The text term used to describe a comorbidity disease, which coexists with the patient's malignant disease.

comorbidity_method_of_diagnosis.description: The text term used to describe the method used to diagnose the patient's comorbidity disease.

days_to_adverse_event.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's adverse event.

days_to_comorbidity.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with a comorbidity.

days_to_imaging.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the imaging or scan was performed on the patient.

days_to_progression.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease progressed.

days_to_progression_free.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease was formally confirmed as progression-free.

days_to_recurrence.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease recurred.

diabetes_treatment_type.description: Text term used to describe the types of treatment used to manage diabetes.

disease_response.description: Code assigned to describe the patient's response or outcome to the disease.

dlco_ref_predictive_percent.description: The value, as a percentage of predicted lung volume, measuring the amount of carbon monoxide detected in a patient's lungs.

ecog_performance_status.description: The ECOG functional performance status of the patient/participant.

evidence_of_recurrence_type.description: The text term used to describe the type of evidence used to determine whether the patient's disease recurred.

eye_color.description: The color of the iris of the eye

fev1_fvc_post_bronch_percent.description: Percentage value to represent result of Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) divided by the Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) post-bronchodilator.

fev1_fvc_pre_bronch_percent.description: Percentage value to represent result of Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) divided by the Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) pre-bronchodilator.

fev1_ref_post_bronch_percent.description: The percentage comparison to a normal value reference range of the volume of air that a patient can forcibly exhale from the lungs in one second post-bronchodilator.

fev1_ref_pre_bronch_percent.description: The percentage comparison to a normal value reference range of the volume of air that a patient can forcibly exhale from the lungs in one second pre-bronchodilator.

haart_treatment_indicator.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient received Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy (HARRT).

height.description: The height of the patient in centimeters.

hepatitis_sustained_virological_response.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient received treatment for a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.

history_of_tumor.description: Indicates whether patient has a history of tumors.

history_of_tumor_type.description: Describes the type of the patient's prior diagnosed tumor.

hiv_viral_load.description: Numeric value that represents the concentration of an analyte or aliquot extracted from the sample or sample portion, measured in milligrams per milliliter.

hormonal_contraceptive_type.description: The specific type of hormonal contraceptives used by the subject.

hormonal_contraceptive_use.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient used hormonal contraceptives.

hormone_replacement_therapy_type.description: The specific type of hormone replacement therapy received by the patient.

hpv_positive_type.description: Text classification to represent the strain or type of human papillomavirus identified in an individual.

hysterectomy_margins_involved.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient's disease was determined to be involved based on the surgical margins of the hysterectomy.

hysterectomy_type.description: The text term used to describe the type of hysterectomy the patient had.

imaging_result.description: The text term used to describe the result of the imaging or scan performed on the patient.

imaging_type.description: The text term used to describe the type of imaging or scan performed on the patient.

immunosuppressive_treatment_type.description: The text term used to describe the type of immunosuppresive treatment the patient received.

karnofsky_performance_status.description: Text term used to describe the classification used of the functional capabilities of a person.

menopause_status.description: Text term used to describe the patient's menopause status.

nadir_cd4_count.description: Numeric value that represents the lowest point to which the CD4 count has dropped (nadir).

pancreatitis_onset_year.description: Numeric value to represent the year that the patient was diagnosed with clinical chronic pancreatitis.

pregnancy_outcome.description: The text term used to describe the type of pregnancy the patient had.

procedures_performed.description: The type of procedures performed on the patient.

progression_or_recurrence.description: Yes/No/Unknown indicator to identify whether a patient has had a new tumor event after initial treatment.

progression_or_recurrence_anatomic_site.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of the progressive or recurrent disease.
enum: Bones of skull and face and associated joints
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues of abdomen
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues of head, face, and neck
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues of lower limb and hip
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues of pelvis
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues of thorax
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues of trunk, NOS
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues of upper limb and shoulder
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues, NOS
Long bones of lower limb and associated joints
Long bones of upper limb, scapula and associated joints
Lymph nodes of axilla or arm
Lymph nodes of head, face and neck
Lymph nodes of inguinal region or leg
Other specified parts of female genital organs
Other specified parts of male genital organs
Overlapping lesion of bones, joints and articular cartilage
Overlapping lesion of bones, joints and articular cartilage of limbs
Overlapping lesion of brain and central nervous system
Overlapping lesion of connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues
Overlapping lesion of endocrine glands and related structures
Overlapping lesion of eye and adnexa
Overlapping lesion of female genital organs
Overlapping lesion of floor of mouth
Overlapping lesion of heart, mediastinum and pleura
Overlapping lesion of lip, oral cavity and pharynx
Overlapping lesion of major salivary glands
Overlapping lesion of male genital organs
Overlapping lesion of other and unspecified parts of mouth
Overlapping lesion of peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system
Overlapping lesion of rectum, anus and anal canal
Overlapping lesion of respiratory system and intrathoracic organs
Overlapping lesion of retroperitoneum and peritoneum
Pelvic bones, sacrum, coccyx and associated joints
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system of abdomen
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system of head, face, and neck
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system of lower limb and hip
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system of pelvis
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system of thorax
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system of trunk, NOS
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system of upper limb and shoulder
Rib, sternum, clavicle and associated joints
Short bones of lower limb and associated joints
Short bones of upper limb and associated joints
Skin of lower limb and hip
Skin of other and unspecified parts of face
Skin of upper limb and shoulder

progression_or_recurrence_type.description: The text term used to describe the type of progressive or recurrent disease or relapsed disease.

recist_targeted_regions_number.description: Numeric value that represents the number of baseline target lesions, as described by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) criteria.

recist_targeted_regions_sum.description: Numeric value that represents the sum of baseline target lesions, as described by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) criteria.

reflux_treatment_type.description: Text term used to describe the types of treatment used to manage gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).

risk_factor.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.
enum: Hereditary Leiomyomatosis and Renal Cell Carcinoma

risk_factor_treatment.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient received treatment for a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.

scan_tracer_used.description: The text term used to describe the type of tracer used during the imaging or scan of the patient.

undescended_testis_corrected.description: Indicates whether the patient's undescended testis was corrected.

undescended_testis_corrected_age.description: The patient's age when their undescended testis was corrected.

undescended_testis_corrected_laterality.description: Descrives the lateral location of the patient's undescended testis correction.

undescended_testis_corrected_method.description: Describes the method used to correct the patient's undescended testis.

undescended_testis_history.description: The persistent failure of one or both testes to descend into the scrotum.

undescended_testis_history_laterality.description: Describes the lateral location of the patient's undescended testis.

viral_hepatitis_serologies.description: Text term that describes the kind of serological laboratory test used to determine the patient's hepatitus status.

weight.description: The weight of the patient measured in kilograms.

description: A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional. A clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures and assessments that may be performed on a subject. A visit has a start and an end, each described with a rule. The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained before and after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

links.label: Follow-Up references the Case it is derived from.
